meanings.definition: Relating to the patterns of rhythm and sound in poetry or language.
meanings.sent1: Her prosodic voice captured the audience's attention during the poetry reading.
meanings.sent2: The prosodic elements of the song made it enjoyable to listen to.
meanings.sent3: The prosodic way she recited the recipe made it sound like a beautiful song.
meanings.sent4: His prosodic speech painted a melodic picture in the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The prosodic nature of the language made it easy to remember.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the intonation, stress, and rhythm of speech.
meanings.sent1: The prosodic variations in her speech made it engaging to listen to.
meanings.sent2: His prosodic delivery of the speech conveyed confidence and authority.
meanings.sent3: The prosodic way he asked for a cookie made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her prosodic tone danced like music in the air.
meanings.sent5: The prosodic rhythm of his words was like a catchy tune.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of the patterns of stress and intonation in language.
meanings.sent1: The prosodic analysis of the speech revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent2: Studying prosodic features helps in understanding language nuances.
meanings.sent3: The prosodic investigation of the joke made it even funnier.
meanings.sent4: Her prosodic exploration of the language was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The prosodic study of the text brought out hidden meanings.
